business.headline: New labour codes: Will variable pay change your salary, PF and gratuity?Will your take-home salary change under the new labour codes, and what will higher variable pay mean for your PF and gratuity in the long run? Let's understand.

Goa fire tragedy: From compensation to insurance, what victims can claimThe Uphaar cinema fire in Delhi, the Kumbakonam school blaze, the Mumbai Kamala Mills fire, the Surat coaching centre tragedy, each incident left behind not just casualties, but families pushed into years of legal battles simply to secure basic compensation.

Johnson & Johnson ordered to pay $40 million to 2 women in talc powder caseThe verdict comes as the company faces tens of thousands of similar lawsuits nationwide and after its latest attempt to resolve the litigation through bankruptcy was rejected by US courts.

How is young India really spending money? Hint: It's not gadgets and clothesYoung Indians' spending habits are shifting quickly, and it's no longer about gadgets or new outfits. Here's a closer look at where their money is actually going.

Cabinet clears 100% FDI in insurance: What the new bill means for the sectorThe government says the changes are designed to offer stronger protection to policyholders and bring more players into the market. This could lead to better products, faster claim settlements, and improved customer service.

Aroon Purie rings NSE bell, says it's for next chapter of India, India Today GroupIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie on Friday rang the closing bell at the National Stock Exchange (NSE) to mark the Group's 50-year journey and said it was for the next chapter of India and the India Today Group.

NSE bell we ring today is for next chapter of India, India Today Group: Aroon PurieThe moment symbolised both a milestone for the media group and a nod to India's financial markets, which have grown alongside the Group's own evolution since 1975.

Video: NSE felicitates India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie on 50-year milestoneNational Stock Exchange (NSE) MD & CEO Ashish Kumar Chauhan on Friday felicitated India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie as the Group completed 50 years at a ceremony in Mumbai.

Retail inflation rises to 0.71% in November from 0.25% in OctoberFood inflation remained in deflation for the sixth straight month, but the pace of decline narrowed sharply. The Consumer Food Price Index showed a contraction of 3.91% in November, compared to a much steeper 5.02% fall in October.

Silver prices cross Rs 2 lakh milestone: Is there more upside left?Silver has been on a strong upward streak over the past month, supported by a softer US dollar, falling global interest rates and renewed buying in industrial commodities.
Video: India Today Chairman Aroon Purie rings NSE bell to mark ITG's 50 yearsIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie rang the NSE bell on Friday to mark the Group's 50 years.
Sensex ends 450 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%Sensex ends 450 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%

India–US trade deal talks move forward, but Delhi refuses to open agriculture marketIndia has refused to allow American agricultural products into the Indian market. India believes that permitting US farm goods would increase competitive pressure on domestic farmers and reduce their income.

Unclaimed wealth is rising in India. How silence around money is costing familiesA growing number of Indian families are learning that wealth without communication can turn into confusion, conflict and costly mistakes. The solution begins long before any will is written.

From TDS gaps to bank errors: Why your ITR refund is delayed and what to do nowSeveral taxpayers in India have not received their income tax refunds for the assessment year 2025-26, with delays attributed to verification errors and compliance checks.

Inside the world of India's ultra-rich: What they buy, how they liveHow are India's wealthiest families redefining luxury today, and what do their latest spending habits reveal about their lifestyles? Let's have a look.

Keys to new homes first, then redevelopment begins: Pranav Adani on Dharavi planPranav Adani said that the Dharavi project is finally progressing with a concrete plan to build around 2 lakh new homes, ensuring residents are moved into these units before any demolition or redevelopment of old structures begins.

NPS expands investment options: Now gold, silver ETFs and Nifty 250 picks allowedIndia's pension regulator issues updated unified investment rules for pension schemes, introducing clearer limits and a wider range of asset classes.

New labour codes: No, your take-home salary isn't reducing. Here's the mathFears of reduced take-home salaries have surged since the new labour codes were notified, but a closer look at the PF calculation shows the impact may not be what many employees expect.

Hindustan Zinc share price jumps over 3%: Why is the stock rising today?Hindustan Zinc's share price advanced over 3% in Friday trading, continuing its upward momentum amid rising silver prices and sector-wide gains in metals stocks.

entertainment.headline: Kerala actor's first post after assault case verdict: Lost faith in this trial court Nearly a week after the Kerala actor assault case verdict, the survivor has shared a post criticising the trial court. "Not every citizen in this country is treated equally before the law," the survivor wrote.

Jacob Elordi snaps at paparazzo: You make it really hard for me to live Actor Jacob Elordi was seen in a video having a heated exchange with a photographer at a Paris train station while trying to remain low-profile. The 28-year-old conveyed his frustration, telling the persistent individual they were making his life difficult as he travelled.

Kareena Kapoor shares glimpse as sons Taimur, Jeh get Messi-ready Lionel Messi has reached Mumbai for his GOAT India Tour 2025. Besides, young players from Maharashtra, celebrities like Kareena Kapoor and her sons are also joining the celebrations.

Sonakshi Sinha slams open attack on actors, critics; wants stricter laws Actor Sonakshi Sinha publicly expressed concern over an increase in online attacks targeting both actors and film critics, describing the trend as deeply disturbing and highlighting the urgent need for stricter laws.

Karan Johar says he feels awkward eating at weddings, standing in food queues Bollywood filmmaker Karan Johar revealed during a discussion with actors Kriti Kharbanda and Pulkit Samrat that he has never eaten at a wedding. The exchange took place as they talked about wedding traditions and preferences.

Awaara, Mera Naam Joker, Prem Rog: Raj Kapoor films that still speak to India From timeless romance to social commentary, Raj Kapoor's classics continue to inspire, entertain, and resonate across generations. On his 101st birth anniversary, here's a look at some of his iconic films that still speak to us.

Wake Up Dead Man Knives Out review: Josh O'Connor owns deliciously unruly whodunitRelease Date:Fri Dec 12, 2025 Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery mixes faith, guilt and murder with Rian Johnson's trademark mischief. Daniel Craig returns as a sharper Benoit Blanc, but Josh O'Connor gives the film its emotional edge.

The Paradise: Nani teases BTS clip, celebrates director Srikanth Odela's birthday Actor Nani celebrated director Srikanth Odela's birthday with a BTS teaser for their upcoming film The Paradise. The actioner is set to release on March 26, 2026.

Akhanda 2 box office Day 2: Nandamuri Balakrishna's film nears Rs 50 crore Balakrishna Nandamuri's Akhanda 2: Thaandavam experienced a strong start at the box office, with a notable drop in collections on its second day. The film, which opened after a delayed release, is performing well across languages and is on track to cross the Rs 50 crore mark in India.

Salman Khan says he's not a great actor: I simply do what I feel in the moment At the Red Sea Film Festival 2025, Salman Khan openly discussed his own acting style, calling himself 'not a great actor'. At the fest, Khan also interacted with Idris Alba and Johnny Depp, among others.

Bait Switch: Dhurandhar's Rehman Dakait and Raj Kapoor's Satyam Shivam Sundaram Dhurandhar draws viewers with its anti-Pakistan spy thriller plot, yet Akshaye Khanna's Rehman Dakait gains massive social media buzz via his FA9LA entry. It echoes Raj Kapoor's Satyam Shivam Sundaram strategy, but inverted unintentionally

Dhurandhar box office: Ranveer Singh's film storms into the Rs 300 crore club Aditya Dhar's period spy thriller Dhurandhar, starring Ranveer Singh, has made a roaring entry into the Rs 300 crore club. With a notable weekend growth, the film has become Singh's second highest-grossing film to date.

The End Of an Era review: An emotional and intimate love letter to SwiftiesRelease Date:Fri Dec 12, 2025 The End Of an Era docuseries offers an intimate backstage glimpse into Taylor Swift's Eras tour. It moves past fandom to reveal vulnerability and care, making it a heartfelt reflection on the tour's cultural impact.

Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu: Chiranjeevi locks Sankranthi release for his next The action-comedy film Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu starring Chiranjeevi is set for a Sankranthi release. The film also stars Nayanthara as the female opposite.

Arjun Rampal announces engagement to longtime partner Gabriella Demetriades Actor Arjun Rampal has announced engagement to his longtime partner and fashion designer Gabriella Demetriades. The couple opened up about the new phase of their relationship on Rhea Chakraborty's podcast.

Dhurandhar is rare as it views India's terror issue from Pak side of the border Dhurandhar bases its story in Pakistan to dissect terror attacks in India, which makes it unique. The film traces the trail of the 26/11 carnage from Lyari to Mumbai.

Soha Ali Khan reviews Kunal Khemu's Single Papa, says it made her heart full Soha Ali Khan has reviewed the comedy series Single Papa, which features her actor-husband Kunal Khemu. She praised the show for its light-hearted and emotional moments.

Kareena Kapoor calls Daayra director Meghna Gulzar tigress in special birthday note As Director Meghna Gulzar celebrated her 52nd birthday, Kareena Kapoor shared an emotional social media tribute from the sets of 'Daayra'. Kapoor called the film one of her most special projects, praising the director as kind, passionate, and sharp, and expressing gratitude for her mentorship.

Hema Malini honours Dharmendra's evergreen appeal in special video tribute Actor-politician Hema Malini honoured the legacy of her late husband, Dharmendra, with a special collage video of his films and family moments, created for prayer meetings in Delhi and Mathura. The tribute highlighted his "evergreen appeal" and included high praise from the late actor Dilip Kumar.

general news.headline: 12 killed in terror attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach, Jews were target Live UpdatesAt least 12 people, including children and a police officer, were killed and nearly 29 injured after gunmen opened fire at Bondi Beach during a Jewish Hanukkah event, in what police believe was a targeted, pre-planned attack.

Naveed Akram identified as one of the gunmen involved in Bondi Beach shootingA shooting erupted on Sunday evening during a public Hanukkah celebration that had drawn large crowds to the Bondi Beach. One of the attackers has now been identified.

Bihar minister Nitin Nabin appointed BJP's National Working PresidentNitin Nabin currently serves as a minister in the Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government, where he holds the Road Construction portfolio.

H-1B, H-4 visas prudentially revoked in US amid interview delays in IndiaAmid the mass rescheduling of H-1B visa interviews in India, many US-based temporary work visa holders have reportedly received emails informing them that their visas have been "prudentially revoked". An immigration expert says many previously cleared issues are being re-reviewed.

Video: Man grabs, overpowers Bondi Beach attackerThe clip captures the chaotic moments during the mass shooting at Bondi Beach, with the man confronting the gunman and disarming him as others flee the scene.

GOAT tour Mumbai Live: Tendulkar gifts Messi Indian jerseyLionel Messi GOAT India Tour 2025 Live: Lionel Messi meets Sachin Tendulkar at the Wankhede Stadium. Sachin gifts Messi an Indian cricket jersey with his name on it. Messi also meets Sunil Chhetri, the legendary Indian football team captain.

Delhi-NCR air disaster: Season's thickest smog, AQI nears 500 in several areasDelhi's air quality has deteriorated sharply, plunging into the hazardous zone amid dense smog and fog. Authorities have invoked Stage-IV emergency measures to combat the severe pollution affecting the capital and NCR region.

Next Sanju Samson? Aaron George, Kerala-born Hyderabad batter, impresses vs PakistanU19 Asia Cup India vs Pakistan: Aaron George played a composed knock of 85 off 88 balls to rescue India after early setbacks in clash against Pakistan in Dubai, building crucial partnerships and drawing comparisons to Sanju Samson with his stylish strokeplay.

Live: PM Anthony Albanese calls Hanukkah shooting an evil antisemitic terror attackSydney Bondi Beach Shooting Live Updates: Multiple people were killed and several others injured after at least two gunmen opened fire on crowds at Bondi Beach, triggering scenes of panic. Police shot dead the attackers, while another suspect is believed to have fled after being disarmed.

India has zero tolerance for terror: PM condemns ghastly Sydney beach attackPrime Minister Narendra Modi condemned the ghastly terrorist attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach that targeted a Jewish Hanukkah event, reiterating India's zero tolerance towards terrorism and expressing solidarity with Australia.

Keep Your Little Ones Cozy This Winter with Amazon Everyday EssentialsWhether you're looking to care for little ones or find the perfect gift, this collection of baby and kids' essentials brings together nourishment, comfort, and thoughtful design.

How Indians are raising the bar at house partiesProfessional bartenders and mixologists are elevating India's house party scene. Bring one in and give your party an instant, caramel-popcorn-level glow-up. Across metros, and even in smaller cities like Jabalpur and Nagpur, you can dial a bar home at just a day's notice. And prices start at just Rs 2,000.

I saw blood gushing: Israel's October 7 survivor injured in Sydney beach shootingA survivor of the October 7 attacks was injured in the Bondi Beach shooting during a Hanukkah celebration, describing scenes of chaos, gunfire and "blood gushing" from his head wound.

Who is Nitin Nabin, the youngest-ever BJP national President?Belonging to a political family, Nitin Nabin entered electoral politics following the death of his father, veteran BJP leader Nabin Kishore Prasad Sinha, and has retained his hold on Bankipur since his by-election victory in 2006.

India Today @ 50 Part 1: Revisiting India's most turbulent decadeIndia Today Group marks its 50th anniversary with a five-part docu-series reflecting on its impactful journey in Indian journalism. The series revisits pivotal moments from 1975 to 1985, highlighting political and cultural shifts that shaped the nation.

Awaara, Mera Naam Joker, Prem Rog: Raj Kapoor films that still speak to IndiaFrom timeless romance to social commentary, Raj Kapoor's classics continue to inspire, entertain, and resonate across generations. On his 101st birth anniversary, here's a look at some of his iconic films that still speak to us.

Messi gets Aadhaar card from fans, Wankhede Stadium echoes with chants: See photoLionel Messi's trip to India: From Marine Drive to Wankhede, fans celebrated Messi with chants, packed local trains and even a mock Aadhaar card, underlining the extraordinary devotion surrounding his Mumbai visit on Sunday, December 14.

Unstoppable India crush Pakistan to continue flawless run in U19 Asia CupIndia U19 extended their unbeaten run in the U19 Asia Cup with a commanding 90-run win over Pakistan in Dubai on Sunday, posting 240 and restricting their rivals to 150.

AIIMS study: Coronary artery disease, not COVID vaccines driving sudden deaths in young adults in IndiaThe study is based on an analysis of 180 autopsies done on people whose passing away were qualified as sudden deaths.

Dhurandhar is rare as it views India's terror issue from Pak side of the borderDhurandhar bases its story in Pakistan to dissect terror attacks in India, which makes it unique. The film traces the trail of the 26/11 carnage from Lyari to Mumbai.

Jurassic Park twist: These dinosaurs ruled rivers before asteroid doomScientists from several countries have determined that mosasaurs, Cretaceous-era marine reptiles, once thrived in freshwater rivers.

Hands up: Video captures students huddling in fear as cops sweep US universityA tragic shooting at Brown University has left two students dead and nine injured, sparking a massive manhunt. Students sheltered in the library as police conducted a tense search for the suspect dressed in black.

Stench to floods: Cries from one of Delhi's poshest neighbourhoodsDefence Colony, once a proud military neighbourhood in Delhi, now grapples with severe neglect, unbearable stench, and flood damage affecting residents' lives and properties. The community faces health risks, property damage, and a loss of legacy as authorities promise action amid ongoing struggles.

sports.headline: Bumrah misses Dharamsala T20I due to personal reasons, returns to Mumbai India vs South Africa, 3rd T20I: Jasprit Bumrah was unavailable for selection on Sunday due to personal reasons. The fast bowler flew to Mumbai and could miss the last two matches of the series.

Unstoppable India crush Pakistan to continue flawless run in U19 Asia Cup India U19 extended their unbeaten run in the U19 Asia Cup with a commanding 90-run win over Pakistan in Dubai on Sunday, posting 240 and restricting their rivals to 150.

Messi's Kolkata Visit Turns Chaotic: Fans Allege Mismanagement, Vandalise Salt Lake Stadium In this Special Report, an Unidentified speaker reports from Kolkata's Yuva Bharati Krirangan on the chaotic scenes during Lionel Messi's visit. The reporter highlights 'total mismanagement' as fans, angry over Messi's brief 'eight to nine minutes' appearance, vandalised the stadium. The transcript details how spectators threw bottles and set fire to seats meant for VVIPs, including Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. Despite the presence of superstars Rodrigo De Paul and Luis Suarez, the event descended into a 'ruckus' with allegations of poor visibility and cancelled interactions.

Messi gets Aadhaar card from fans, Wankhede Stadium echoes with chants: See photo Lionel Messi's trip to India: From Marine Drive to Wankhede, fans celebrated Messi with chants, packed local trains and even a mock Aadhaar card, underlining the extraordinary devotion surrounding his Mumbai visit on Sunday, December 14.

Messi event fiasco will hurt Kolkata for decades: Indian football chief Kalyan Chaubey AIFF president Kalyan Chaubey slammed the West Bengal government over chaos at Lionel Messi's Kolkata event, warning poor planning could hurt the city and India's global sporting image for decades.

Two days before IPL auction, Sarfaraz Khan smashes 25-ball 64 for Mumbai Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy: Sarfaraz Khan smashed 64 in just 25 balls, leading Mumbai's successful chase of 235 against Haryana. Sarfaraz is likely to trigger a bidding war in the IPL 2026 mini auction, scheduled in Abu Dhabi on Tuesday, December 16.

Ashes: England security guard gets involved in heated face-off with media person A confrontation unfolded at Brisbane airport when an England cricket team security official had a heated exchange with a Channel Seven cameraman during the squad's check-in for their Adelaide flight.

Insult or banter? BBL trolls Babar Azam after Pakistan batter fails on debut Pakistan batter Babar Azam made a disappointing BBL debut for Sydney Sixers on December 14, scoring just two runs off five balls before being dismissed by Brody Couch, sparking online trolling.

Next Sanju Samson? Aaron George, Kerala-born Hyderabad batter, impresses vs Pakistan U19 Asia Cup India vs Pakistan: Aaron George played a composed knock of 85 off 88 balls to rescue India after early setbacks in clash against Pakistan in Dubai, building crucial partnerships and drawing comparisons to Sanju Samson with his stylish strokeplay.

U19 Asia Cup: Did India, Pakistan defy ICC directive by snubbing handshake? India Under-19s maintained their no-handshake stance against Pakistan in the Asia Cup despite an ICC push for protocol, keeping the spotlight on the ongoing handshake debate as the rivals are likely to meet again later in the tournament.

Jaiswal's blistering 100 puts selectors on notice ahead of T20 World CupYashasvi Jaiswal scored a blazing century to help Mumbai chase 235 against Haryana in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. His performance intensifies calls for his inclusion in India's T20I squad amid Shubman Gill's poor form.

Watch: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's dismissal triggers frenzy in Pakistan dugoutIndia vs Pakistan, U19 Asia Cup: Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Sayyam celebrated Vaibhav Suryavanshi's wicket in explosive fashion, while the Pakistan dug-out was equally chuffed, recognising the significance of dismissing the 14-year-old batting prodigy early on Sunday in Dubai.

Bhaichung Bhutia Slams 'VIP Culture' For Chaos At Lionel Messi's Kolkata EventFormer Indian football captain Bhaichung Bhutia has strongly criticised the mismanagement at Lionel Messi's recent event in Kolkata. Speaking on the chaos that unfolded at the Salt Lake Stadium during the 'GOAT India Tour 2025', Bhutia blamed 'VIP culture' for denying genuine fans a glimpse of the Argentine legend. He stated, 'The genuine fans did not really get to see Messi.' Bhutia noted that while organisers tried their best, the situation spiralled out of control due to the presence of unauthorised VIPs who crowded the venue. The football icon expressed hope that such mistakes would not be repeated in the future.

Cameron Green clarifies manager's IPL auction gaffe. Will it affect bidding war?Australia all-rounder Cameron Green has registered as a batter for IPL 2026 auction scheduled to be held in Abu Dhabi on December 16. Green has kept his base price at Rs 2 Crore and is expected to trigger bidding wars between franchises.

India Today's Anirban Sinha Roy Reports: VIPs Hijack Messi Event in Kolkata, Fans StrandedIn this Special Report, India Today's Anirban Sinha Roy reports on the chaotic scenes at Kolkata's Salt Lake Stadium during Lionel Messi's historic visit. The journalist highlights how 'Neta monkeys' and their associates, including actress Subhashree Ganguly, hijacked the event, leaving ordinary fans stranded outside. Roy notes that while VIPs and their families managed to click photos with the Argentine legend, genuine ticket-holders were denied a glimpse. The broadcast also covers the political fallout, with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) demanding the resignation of the West Bengal Sports Minister over the mismanagement. The report underscores the stark contrast between the 'passion' of the fans and the 'privilege' of the ruling class.

Messi lost his cool, was frustrated: First-hand witness recalls Kolkata chaosFormer India midfielder Lalkamal Bhowmick said Messi appeared visibly unsettled during the GOAT Tour event at Kolkata's Vivekananda Yuvabharati Stadium, prompting security to step in and cut short his appearance on Saturday.

Rajasthan Royals IPL 2026 auction strategy explained: Five players RR can targetIPL 2026 mini auction: With Rs 16.05 crores to work with, the Rajasthan Royals are in dire need of an attacking-minded spin option. With limited options in the auction list, the franchise would be pressured to break the bank for a specialist spinner. In addition, the franchise has kept silent on its captain for the coming season. It would be interesting to see if they pursue any captaincy candidates in the auction.

GOAT tour Mumbai Live: Tendulkar gifts Messi Indian jerseyLionel Messi GOAT India Tour 2025 Live: Lionel Messi meets Sachin Tendulkar at the Wankhede Stadium. Sachin gifts Messi an Indian cricket jersey with his name on it. Messi also meets Sunil Chhetri, the legendary Indian football team captain.

IND vs PAK Highlights: India blow away Pakistan by 90 runs in DubaiIND vs PAK U-19 Asia Cup Highlights: India beat Pakistan by 90 runs in Dubai and made it 2 out of 2 in the ongoing tournament. They also displaced Pakistan from the top of the table.

Bhutia slams Messi's Kolkata visit fiasco, says it tarnishes India's imageBhaichung Bhutia has expressed disappointment over the mishandling of Lionel Messi's Kolkata visit at Salt Lake Stadium, highlighting the negative impact on the country's image and urging organizers to prioritize genuine fans in future events.

Kerala roots, spark by 2011 World Cup: Alishan Sharafu's UAE rise and IPL dreamInspired by India's 2011 World Cup heroes, Alishan Sharafu holds on to big dreams with the UAE and has set himself a major goal by making it to the IPL. The Abu Dhabi Knight Riders star talks about his journey, facing India on the international stage and more.

What's the story with Gautam Gambhir and the omnipresent cricket ball?Have you noticed what's always in coach Gautam Gambhir's frame? The cricket ball. Are we reading too much into a simple habit? Probably. But like everyone else, we can't help interpreting everything Gautam Gambhir does, and doesn't do.

John Cena ends WWE chapter with gritty loss vs Gunther at Saturday's Main EventSaturday Night's Main event: John Cena's legendary WWE career has come to an end as he lost to Gunther via submission on Sunday, December 14.

IND vs SA 3rd T20I Predicted XIs: Will experimental India bring in Kuldeep?India are set to take on South Africa in third T20I in Dharamsala. The team management might be tempted to bring in Kuldeep Yadav after bowling failure in the second match.

VIPs first, fans later: How Messi tour's Kolkata flop exposed misplaced prioritiesLionel Messi's presence could not mask what unfolded in Kolkata. The event laid bare a system where optics mattered more than organisation, and fans paid the price for failures not of their making.

IND vs SA 3rd T20I: Runs, risks and experiments to continue in cold Dharamshala?India vs South Africa 3rd T20I preview: The experiments within the Indian team is expected to continue as they take on South Africa in chilly Dharamshala on Sunday, December 13. With pressure mounting on Suryakumar and Gill, can India find the right answers to all their questions against an upbeat Proteas side?

Fan paid Rs 10,000 to see Lionel Messi in Kolkata, ends up stealing carpet insteadA Lionel Messi fan in Kolkata paid Rs 10,000 for a ticket but did not get a glimpse of the football icon as chaos forced the event to end early, leaving behind anger, damage and an unforgettable story.

Lionel Messi's GOAT Tour redeems itself in Hyderabad after Kolkata chaosAfter the chaos in Kolkata, Hyderabad delivered a fan-first Messi experience, with smooth organisation, clear sightlines and genuine player interaction, restoring faith in the GOAT tour.

India our second home, Afghanistan aiming higher in T20 World Cup: Gulbadin NaibAfghanistan veteran Gulbadin Naib says the team will use their "second home" India and IPL experience to push harder for the T20 World Cup 2026 title after their historic 2024 semi-final run.

Lionel Messi in Hyderabad: Football Icon Meets CM Revanth Reddy, Set for Match at Uppal StadiumIn this breaking news report, India Today's Abdul Basheer details Lionel Messi's high-profile visit to Hyderabad. The Argentine legend met Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy at Taj Falaknuma Palace and is scheduled to play a friendly match at Uppal Stadium. The report confirms that Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi will also attend the event. Basheer highlights the heightened security measures following alleged lapses during Messi's Kolkata visit, noting that the Telangana DGP has alerted officers to ensure a smooth event.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
